====== getInstance ======
^ API ^ Package ^ Class ^ phpDocumentor ^ Last reviewed ^ Doc status ^
| {{http://api.joomla.org/media/images/package.png?nolink}} [[references:joomla.framework|Joomla.Framework]] | {{http://api.joomla.org/media/images/package.png?nolink}} [[references:joomla.framework/#Cache|Cache]] | {{http://api.joomla.org/media/images/Class.png?nolink}}[[JCache|JCache]] | [[http://api.joomla.org/Joomla-Framework/Cache/JCache.html#getInstance|JCache->getInstance]] | Never | Public review |

Returns a reference to the global cache object, only creating it if it doesn't already exist.
===== Syntax =====
JCache &getInstance	( **$handler**, **$options** )
| **$handler** | string | is a string containing the cache handler to instantiate. The currently available handlers are: Function, Hash, Output and Page. This parameter is optional and if omitted defaults to 'Function'. |
| **$options** | array | is an associative array of cache options. See [[references:joomla.framework:cache:jcache-__construct|_construct]] for more information. |

===== Examples =====
This function is called by the [[references:joomla.framework:jfactory-getCache|JFactory::getCache]] method using the following code:
<code php|Example>
$cache =& JCache::getInstance( $handler, $options );
</code>
